+      "description": "Requires replacing embedded PuTTY with a native .NET SSH terminal control to enable text buffer access and search functionality."
+    }

+  "notes": "AI triage (gemini): Requires replacing embedded PuTTY with a native .NET SSH terminal control to enable text buffer access and search functionality.\nApproach: Replace PuTTY usage with a native terminal emulator control (e.g., utilizing SSH.NET) that exposes the text buffer for search operations."
 }

 }

diff --git a/mRemoteNGDocumentation/folders_and_inheritance.rst b/mRemoteNGDocumentation/folders_and_inheritance.rst
index 4805420c4..b326c7ccc 100644
--- a/mRemoteNGDocumentation/folders_and_inheritance.rst
+++ b/mRemoteNGDocumentation/folders_and_inheritance.rst
@@ -76,3 +76,9 @@ related connections in the tree view.
 .. note::
    The Color property can be inherited just like other properties. Enable inheritance
    in the inheritance view to have connections automatically use their parent folder's color.
+
+Default Connection Properties
+=============================
+You can also configure the default properties and inheritance settings for all *new* connections and folders you create. This is different from folder inheritance, which applies settings from a parent folder to its children.
+
+For more information, see :doc:`user_interface/default_connection_properties`.
diff --git a/mRemoteNGDocumentation/user_interface/default_connection_properties.rst b/mRemoteNGDocumentation/user_interface/default_connection_properties.rst
index 1dad4167e..ddf553014 100644
--- a/mRemoteNGDocumentation/user_interface/default_connection_properties.rst
+++ b/mRemoteNGDocumentation/user_interface/default_connection_properties.rst
@@ -2,7 +2,12 @@
 Default Connection Properties
 *****************************
 
-Default connection properties are a template that is applied when creating new connections. You can set both property values and inheritance settings that will be set in new connections.
+Default connection properties act as a template for all new connections and folders. When you create a new item, it is initialized with these settings.
+
+This feature consists of two parts:
+
+1.  **Default Properties**: The initial values (e.g., Protocol = RDP, Username = Admin).
+2.  **Default Inheritance**: Which properties are set to inherit from their parent folder by default.
 
 .. note::
 	Currently, default connection properties are saved within the user settings of mRemoteNG and not with the connection file. Sharing a connection file between multiple machines will not share default connection properties.
@@ -13,7 +18,10 @@ How it is used
 
 New Folders/Connections
 -----------------------
-When a new folder or connection is created, all default properties and default inheritance are applied to it.
+When a new folder or connection is created:
+
+1.  Properties are set to the values defined in **Default Properties**.
+2.  Inheritance flags (whether to inherit from parent) are set according to **Default Inheritance**.
 
 .. note::
 	Changing default properties does not affect existing connections. The default values are only applied when the connection is first created.

diff --git a/mRemoteNGDocumentation/folders_and_inheritance.rst b/mRemoteNGDocumentation/folders_and_inheritance.rst
index 4805420c4..b326c7ccc 100644
--- a/mRemoteNGDocumentation/folders_and_inheritance.rst
+++ b/mRemoteNGDocumentation/folders_and_inheritance.rst
@@ -76,3 +76,9 @@ related connections in the tree view.
 .. note::
    The Color property can be inherited just like other properties. Enable inheritance
    in the inheritance view to have connections automatically use their parent folder's color.
+
+Default Connection Properties
+=============================
+You can also configure the default properties and inheritance settings for all *new* connections and folders you create. This is different from folder inheritance, which applies settings from a parent folder to its children.
+
+For more information, see :doc:`user_interface/default_connection_properties`.
diff --git a/mRemoteNGDocumentation/user_interface/default_connection_properties.rst b/mRemoteNGDocumentation/user_interface/default_connection_properties.rst
index 1dad4167e..ddf553014 100644
--- a/mRemoteNGDocumentation/user_interface/default_connection_properties.rst
+++ b/mRemoteNGDocumentation/user_interface/default_connection_properties.rst
@@ -2,7 +2,12 @@
 Default Connection Properties
 *****************************
 
-Default connection properties are a template that is applied when creating new connections. You can set both property values and inheritance settings that will be set in new connections.
+Default connection properties act as a template for all new connections and folders. When you create a new item, it is initialized with these settings.
+
+This feature consists of two parts:
+
+1.  **Default Properties**: The initial values (e.g., Protocol = RDP, Username = Admin).
+2.  **Default Inheritance**: Which properties are set to inherit from their parent folder by default.
 
 .. note::
 	Currently, default connection properties are saved within the user settings of mRemoteNG and not with the connection file. Sharing a connection file between multiple machines will not share default connection properties.
@@ -13,7 +18,10 @@ How it is used
 
 New Folders/Connections
 -----------------------
-When a new folder or connection is created, all default properties and default inheritance are applied to it.
+When a new folder or connection is created:
+
+1.  Properties are set to the values defined in **Default Properties**.
+2.  Inheritance flags (whether to inherit from parent) are set according to **Default Inheritance**.
 
 .. note::
 	Changing default properties does not affect existing connections. The default values are only applied when the connection is first created.
